alert.note: Alert for Lander (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 24 at 10:36AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Battle Mountain affecting Lander County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Battle Mountain. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Minor lowland flooding throughout the reach. A few rural roads begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM PDT Monday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning and continue rising to a crest of 9.5 feet late this morning. It will then rise to 9.8 feet early Friday afternoon. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.8 feet on 06/17/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1100 AM PDT.
